title: Quadrotor Drone Model
content:
## Quadrotor Drone Model

#### Frame

inertial reference frame $I$, ENU

body-fixed frame $B$, FLU

#### Dynamics

$x\in \mathbb{R}^3 $ positiion in $I$

$v\in \mathbb{R}^3$ velocity in $I$ 

$R\in \mathbf{SO}(3)$ oriention of $B$ with respect to $I$

$\Omega \in \mathbb{R}^3$ angular velocity in $B$

$$
\dot{x}=v
$$

$$
\dot{v}=\frac{1}{m}(T-mg\vec{e_3}+F_d)
$$

$$
\dot{R}=R\hat{\Omega}
$$

$$
\dot{\Omega}=J^{-1}(\Omega\times J\Omega+M+M_d)
$$

where,

$$
\vec{e_3}=[0\ 0\ 1]^T
$$

$$
T=fR\vec{e_3}
$$

$$
\hat{\Omega}=\begin{bmatrix}
0 & -\Omega_z &\Omega_y\\
\Omega_z &0 & -\Omega_x\\
-\Omega_y &\Omega_x &0\\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

using euler angle for rotation

$Z-\psi$ Yaw,

$Y-\theta$ Pitch,

$X-\phi$ Roll

$$
R(Z,\psi)=\begin{bmatrix}
c\psi& -s\psi &0\\
s\psi& c\psi &0\\
0& 0& 1\\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

$$
R(Y,\theta)=\begin{bmatrix}
c\theta& 0  &s\theta\\
0&1&0\\
-s\theta& 0 & c\theta\\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

$$
R(X,\phi)=\begin{bmatrix}
1&0&0\\
0  &c\phi& -s\phi\\
0  &s\phi& c\phi\\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

$$
R=R(Z,\psi)R(Y,\theta)R(X,\phi)=\begin{bmatrix}
c\psi c\theta & c\psi s\theta s\phi - s\psi c\phi & c\psi s\theta c\phi + s\psi s\phi \\
s\psi c\theta & s\psi s\theta s\phi + c\psi c\phi & s\psi s\theta c\phi - c\psi s\phi \\
-s\theta & c\theta s\phi & c\theta c\phi
\end{bmatrix}
$$

derivation of attitude dynamics using euler angle

- kinematics

$$
I\rightarrow R(Z,\psi)\rightarrow B'\rightarrow R(Y,\theta)
\rightarrow B''\rightarrow R(X,\phi)\rightarrow B'''
$$

$$
\begin{aligned}{\Omega} &= {(R(Y,\theta)R(X,\phi))}^{-1}\dot{\psi}z'+R^{-1}(X,\phi)\dot{\theta}y''+\dot{\phi}z'''\\
&=R_x(\phi)^{-1} R_y(\theta)^{-1} \begin{bmatrix}
0 \\
0 \\
\dot{\psi}
\end{bmatrix}
+
R_x(\phi)^{-1} \begin{bmatrix}
0 \\
\dot{\theta} \\
0
\end{bmatrix}
+
\begin{bmatrix}
\dot{\phi} \\
0 \\
0
\end{bmatrix}
\end{aligned}
$$

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
\Omega_x \\
\Omega_y \\
\Omega_z
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0 & -\sin\theta \\
0 & \cos\phi & \cos\theta \sin\phi \\
0 & -\sin\phi & \cos\theta \cos\phi
\end{bmatrix}
\begin{bmatrix}
\dot{\phi} \\
\dot{\theta} \\
\dot{\psi}
\end{bmatrix}
=F(\theta,\phi)\begin{bmatrix}
\dot{\phi} \\
\dot{\theta} \\
\dot{\psi}
\end{bmatrix}
$$

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
\dot{\phi} \\
\dot{\theta} \\
\dot{\psi}
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & \sin\phi \tan\theta & \cos\phi \tan\theta \\
0 & \cos\phi & -\sin\phi \\
0 & \sin\phi / \cos\theta & \cos\phi / \cos\theta
\end{bmatrix}
\begin{bmatrix}
\Omega_x \\
\Omega_y \\
\Omega_z
\end{bmatrix}=
F^{-1}(\theta,\phi)\begin{bmatrix}
\Omega_x \\
\Omega_y \\
\Omega_z
\end{bmatrix}
$$

- dynamics

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
\dot{\Omega_x} \\
\dot{\Omega_y} \\
\dot{\Omega_z}
\end{bmatrix}=\begin{bmatrix}
J_{xx}^{-1}(\Omega_2\Omega_3(J_{yy}-J_{zz})+M_x)\\
J_{yy}^{-1}(\Omega_1\Omega_3(J_{zz}-J_{xx})+M_y)\\
J_{zz}^{-1}(\Omega_1\Omega_2(J_{xx}-J_{yy})+M_z)\\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

- releation

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
\dot{\Omega_x} \\
\dot{\Omega_y} \\
\dot{\Omega_z}
\end{bmatrix}=\dot{F}\begin{bmatrix}
\dot{\phi} \\
\dot{\theta} \\
\dot{\psi}
\end{bmatrix}+F\begin{bmatrix}
\ddot{\phi} \\
\ddot{\theta} \\
\ddot{\psi}
\end{bmatrix}
$$

where,

$$
\dot{F}=\frac{\partial{F}}{\partial{\theta}}\dot{\theta}
+\frac{\partial{F}}{\partial{\phi}}\dot{\phi}
$$

translational dynamics using euler angle

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
\dot{v_x}\\
\dot{v_y}\\
\dot{v_z}\\
\end{bmatrix}=
m^{-1}\begin{bmatrix}
 c\psi s\theta c\phi + s\psi s\phi \\
 s\psi s\theta c\phi - c\psi s\phi \\
c\theta c\phi
\end{bmatrix}f
-
\begin{bmatrix}
0\\
0\\
g\\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

simplification

let $\theta,\phi \rightarrow 0$, $F\rightarrow I_{3}$

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
\dot{v_x}\\
\dot{v_y}\\
\dot{v_z}\\
\end{bmatrix}=
m^{-1}\begin{bmatrix}
 0\\
 0 \\
1
\end{bmatrix}f
-
\begin{bmatrix}
0\\
0\\
g\\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
\dot{\phi} \\
\dot{\theta} \\
\dot{\psi}
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
\Omega_x \\
\Omega_y \\
\Omega_z
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Quaternion http://in.ruc.edu.cn/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/quaternion.pdf

$$
q=q_0+q_1i+q_2j+q_3k=[q_0\ q_1\ q_2\ q_3]^T
$$

basic

$$
i^2=j^2=k^2=ijk=-1
\\ ij=k,jk=i,ki=j
\\ ji=-k,kj=-i,ik=-j
$$

$$
||q||=\sqrt{q_0^2+q_1^2+q_2^2+q_3^2}
$$

for rotation axis $||[x\ y\ z]||=1$, angle $\theta$:

$$
q=\cos(\frac{\theta}{2})+\sin(\frac{\theta}{2})(xi+yj+zk)
$$

let $p=[p_0 \ p_1\ p_2\ p_3]$

$$
q \otimes p = \begin{bmatrix}
q_0 p_0 - q_1 p_1 - q_2 p_2 - q_3 p_3 \\
q_0 p_1 + q_1 p_0 + q_2 p_3 - q_3 p_2 \\
q_0 p_2 - q_1 p_3 + q_2 p_0 + q_3 p_1 \\
q_0 p_3 + q_1 p_2 - q_2 p_1 + q_3 p_0
\end{bmatrix}\neq p\otimes q
$$

$$
q*=[q_0\ -q_1\ -q_2\ -q_3]^T\\
q\otimes q*=||q||^2
$$

rotate a vector $v=[v_0\ v_1\ v_2]^T$ by quaternion

$$
v'=q\otimes v_q\otimes q*
$$

where,

$$
v_q=[0\ v_0\ v_1\ v_2 ]^T
$$

multi rotation ,$q_1\rightarrow q_2\rightarrow q_3=q_3\otimes q_2\otimes q_1$

derivative

$$
\dot{q}=\frac{1}{2}q\otimes \Omega_q
$$
